ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Exception in usage of BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy in Heritrix-2.0.0
ygData.msgSnippet: FYI, BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy is a contributed class and not yet covered by our release testing. It looks like it wasn t properly adapted to the

From: Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...>
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Exception in usage of BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy
 in Heritrix-2.0.0
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=IzZK8HjDk7rnMFvp3VsQxtpx1nlcimyVUQvaNSOUBMA9
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

FYI, BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy is a contributed class and not yet 
covered by our release testing.

It looks like it wasn't properly adapted to the heritrix-2.0.0 settings 
conventions. In particular, the settings Key field should be public, and 
there should be the addKeys registration (which relies on the field 
being public).

I've just corrected those two issues, and added a skeletal 
BucketQueueAssignmentPolicyTest class which can perform some generic 
tests of any configurable module.

This may resolve your issue, though I have not verified that 
BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy functions properly in a realistic use.

I also made an issue to track this:

http://webteam.archive.org/jira/browse/HER-1493

- Gordon @ IA

Pratyush Banerjee wrote:
> Hi All,
> 
> I have been using Heritrix-2.0.0 for web-crawling. Recently i tried changing the Queue Assignment Policy from the default 
> SurtAuthorityQueueAssignmentPolicy to BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy. 
> 
> However after configuring the job when i am trying to launch my job then it throws an exception saying 
> 
> java.lang.RuntimeException: org.archive.state.UnregisteredKeyException: Unregistered key in class org.archive.crawler.frontier.BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy; 
> 
> There are two separate places in the web-UI where once can change the policy. I have tried using both or one or the other with no results. 
> In every case the same error occurs. 
> 
> I also tried registering the? keys using KeyManager.addKeys( org.archive.crawler.frontier.BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy.class) but it throws up an exception saying invalid keys for the class. 
> 
> Am i doing something wrong or missing some other Key Settings or its a bug with the code. It would be greatly helpful to know how i can make this work. 
> 
> Please find the log attached below. 
>
